title: Updated Patch Notes layout. Thoughts?
body:
You guys have probably noticed that the [Patch 4.2 Notes](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-42-notes) look significantly different from our previous releases ([4.1 Notes](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-41-notes) for comparison). We've changed a lot, particularly in how we handle balance changes.

The team (myself, **RiotPwyff**, **MoltovCarrot** and **Azrael**) would love to get your thoughts on the revamp and where we still have room for improvement. Feel free to get super granular and super specific - we've been going through the changes with a fine-toothed comb, so you won't lose us in the details.

And for those of you who can't quite put your finger on what about the change you like or dislike, I've added a basic poll so you can still let us know how you feel overall.

- - -

**PS:** Readers who landed here from other sites, remember that those of you from EUW and EUNE can post here now!

replies.body: Absolutely love the new layout. Easier to read, easier to see changes and much better looking with cleaner layout and images.

The new format looks fantastic! It makes the patch changes a lot easier to see and compare to their previous iterations. In particular, laying out the damage increase formula on Ziggs's passive gives a much clearer picture on how its damage evolves as he levels up.

This may not be a huge bit of criticism, but it would be nice if you gave more visual indications to some of your changes. It would be awesome to see Ashe and Soraka's new icons in the patch notes, and perhaps even get a visual on Xerath and Skarner's reworks as well as the new effects on the updated summoner spells.

I'm not a fan of the strikethrough format. It feels redundant and cluttered. Specifying that values were lowered at later ranks, for example, felt easier to read and showed your intent more clearly.

Also the ToC looks very scrambled (I know this hasn't changed). At a glance it's not obvious what the horizontal rules are separating. And having the larger headings share lines just looks awkward, especially when it means the headings with subsections get a single line while the ones without will share a line.

On a positive note the individual entries are very clear and look much better. The champion entries aren't cluttered anymore, nor are their abilities. Definitely an upgrade here IMO.
Could you go into more detail regarding your issues with the strikethrough? Is it just harder to read the text with the ST, or is it the overall order of information that's bugging you?

I know I personally get confused by a strikethrough "double-negative" effect when I glance through the patch notes. For example, this line from Skarner's rework:  
"Effect :: ~~No longer provides an Attack speed bonus~~"  
When scanning across that line, my first thought is: "Wait, does that mean there is now an attack speed bonus or not?" The previous context is not clear in the way it is for the numerical changes, where the old numbers are clearly marked. I'd much rather you just state the ultimate result of the changes and the fact that it changed, rather than striking through a previous notice of removal.
Ah, yes. Good catch on the double negative. Definitely a little confusing.

Strikethrough in general just makes it more strenuous to read, especially when combod with the red font. IMO something like this would be more appropriate for Kayle (nothing special about Kayle):  

---  

#{{champion:10}}  Kayle
*We lowered Reckoning’s AP ratio while raising the AP ratio of Divine Blessing’s heal. We also added an AP ratio to Divine Blessing’s movement speed bonus and removed Intervention’s mana cost.*  

Once she gets ahead, Kayle's burst damage can be overwhelming to play against. While we're taking away some of Kayle's up-front burst, the utility scaling on Divine Blessing should help her and her team get INTO (and out of) THE FRAY.

>####{{champion:10}} Q - Reckoning  
---  
Reckoning's burst damage was too high so we reduced the AP ratio. 
#####Ability power ratio: 
* #####Old :: 1.0  
* #####New :: 0.6

>####{{champion:10}} W - Divine Blessing 
---  
Divine Blessing's heal was too weak compared to other champions, and we wanted to extend the recent utility scaling changes to Kayle. 
#####Heal/Ability power ratio: 
* #####Old :: 0.35  
* #####New :: 0.45

>#####Movement speed bonus: 
* #####now scales with ability power (+7% per 100 ability power)

>####{{champion:10}} R - Intervention  
---  
Reason (I have no idea why she got this) 
#####Mana cost: 
* #####Old :: 100 / 75 / 50  
* #####New :: 0 at all ranks
   
---


You're going to have to use your imagination here since I couldn't do everything I was trying with the formatting. Substitute the block quotes and list bullets for indents and decrease the vertical spacing between the header and the block quote(caused from the header format). Personally I think this is more readable and the reason for each specific change is available right next to the change.  

Also as I was making that I noticed that the color and size of "Ability Power Ratio : :" made it kind of annoying to read. I'd suggest increasing the font size by a point or 2 and/or darkening the color just a little bit.

I actually like the strikethrough. Makes it very easy at a glance to focus on the new values. I would say to keep including the old values though instead of only having strikethrough text, though maybe for effect removal or adding just a description would be ok.

Example - I would prefer this to what is currently there for Skarner's W:

EFFECT :: ~~Provides an Attack speed bonus~~ -> No attack speed bonus
Agreed. The ToC needs some serious love. We're exploring a completely new format for it.

I actually like the strikethroughs for the stats, but in the instances discog mentioned (where text like "No longer slows" is striked), I'll agree that it does seem a bit confusing.

Great work on the updates overall. I found it way easier to read and I'm happy to see most of the red body text gone. I'm interested to see how you guys plan on utilizing that right column better!

I liked the old ones in that the descriptions were in different colors; having the patch notes and their justifications in the same color makes it seem very monochromatic. I do like the abilities being listed with the icons and everything to avoid confusion though. However, the reworks look a little sloppy; the two of them look completely different and there's no standardization.

Xerath's rework looks lean and mean, while Skarner's looks like you're trying to justify the changes to him by saying "we moved this here and that there" with the mess of tooltip changes and strikethroughs; it makes it look like you guys were confident in the Xerath rework and didn't feel the need to list the old abilities, while Skarner's rework will be more controversial and must be justified instead of just listing what his abilities do now.
So much nicer! Thanks guys! :D

Would be nice if the Related Content section at the top right didn't make for a huge empty space down the entire side of the patch notes, although that's also an issue with the general layout of the new site (like how almost half this thread is empty grey space for me because of my monitor size).
Yeah, I have plans for using that right column better in future versions of the patch notes.

Don't you think it might be relevant to include the old numbers in the instance of people that don't necessarily play the champion but play against the champion a bit? I don't think Riot should ever remove information from the patch notes just to preserve someone's feelings about a "nerf".

I like the new layout myself. It's easier to navigate to what I find important, or if I need to double check that I didn't read something wrong the first time.  The organization and navigation make it much nicer.

  The look is a bit cleaner as well.  GG Riot!
Improvement. A -lot- easier to dash from point of interest to point of interest.
It's nice!~~{{champion:84}} ~~
I enjoyed the new format.

The new layout surprised me -- in a good way. I like that Riot is putting more care into the little things. Keep up the good work on that.

My only issues (and small ones at that) is that;

- the patch mentions new ability icons / doesn't show them
- the patch mentions new particles for old Xerath skins / doesn't show them

Patch notes overall need just a bit more tweaking -- but again, it looks great & good job.

Nice work with the new layout. Since you gave us the opportunity to add some champion icons, I would love to see a sub-community to make builds for champions like in mobafire. I hope you will do that so that we don't have to open mobafire anymore. It would be good to have that on league of legends official site.
yes，I agree.:p

I like the change, but the one thing I noticed (and disliked) most is in the champion ability change format. I'm not a fan of how separated the ability name feels from the description of what was changed. The small text size for the change vs. the size of the ability name really threw me off for the abilities with only one change, especially when it was at the end of a champion's section. (See Kayle ult notes)

I just think that making the first part (" Mana cost:: ") bold, darker, and a little bigger would make it feel like less of a chore to pick out the actual changes from the rest of the bloat.
Not sure if its the new patch, but the connection and my ping has risen a lot, and now i cant even log back in. Is this due to my connection, or new patch!?! Really just want to play :D
I honestly have no problems with the changed format, alot nicer, smoother, fine by me. any other changes we could be expecting like drop boxes, tabs, etc?
Tabs are a possibility, although a better ToC format might get the job done better. What do you mean by drop boxes?

alot like the hot links you already have, seems redundant now that I think about it. Little boxes you would click, that would drop down to the subject. They're the same kind of directory.  My bad, lol.
I genuinely didn't even notice you changed anything.

The white border that you stuff it into could be widened, and then you turn it into a double page format.

Instead of scrolling dow so far, you implement a lot of unused page spaced, while having a line down the middle to visually separate the "pages". You could have the Skarner and Xerath rework side by side. You would be able to see/acess the information faster instead of having a tall wall of words.
The new layout looks good to me. Also, i think this format will change the perspective of some other people

While I feel like the new patch notes mince words a little more and a little better than the old layout of patch notes did, I feel like looking at actual stats could be improved.  Overall, I'm going to say that I like this new layout more overall, but at the same time I feel like it could use some adjustments.  Another such adjustment would be to make them just a little smaller.  I feel like this new layout is rather bulky when compared to the previous layout.
why is there a promble with your sever i can't play what happen????

I'm looking at them side by side and the amount of difference I'm noticing is minimal.  



That said, I think I like the red text better than the gray text for riot comments.
I don't really like the new layout. So much empty space on the left of the play button. Is there anyway we can add something there? Like maybe adding our MMR or LoLking stats?
not happy at all of yasuo being nerfed .. you guys need to bring him back they way he was in 4.1 im just not happy at all my fav champ is being nerfed
